schemeSubCategory.value: Education and training grants, fellowship, stipend
schemeSubCategory.label: Education and training grants, fellowship, stipend

schemeContent.detailedDescription_md: The Reimbursement of the MS-CIT Course scheme was launched by the Maharashtra Building And Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWW), Labour Department Maharashtra. The scheme offers reimbursement of the MS-CIT (Maharashtra State Certificate in Information Technology) course fees for up to two children of registered construction workers.
schemeContent.benefits_md: - Reimbursement of the MS-CIT (Maharashtra State Certificate in Information Technology) course fees for up to two children of registered construction workers.
schemeContent.briefDescription: The Reimbursement of the MS-CIT Course scheme was launched by the Maharashtra Building And Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWW), Labour Department Maharashtra.

children.text: The Reimbursement of the MS-CIT Course scheme was launched by the Maharashtra Building And Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWW), Labour Department Maharashtra. The scheme offers reimbursement of the MS-CIT (Maharashtra State Certificate in Information Technology) course fees for up to two children of registered construction workers.
Reimbursement of the MS-CIT (Maharashtra State Certificate in Information Technology) course fees for up to two children of registered construction workers.
In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer.

Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).

applicationProcess.process_md:
**Step-1:** The interested applicant downloads the [application form](https://mahabocw.in/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/SCHEME_HEALTH_FORM-1.pdf) from the MBOCWW official website. 
**Step-2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step-3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer.
**Step-4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).

eligibilityCriteria.eligibilityDescription_md: 1. The children's parents/guardians should be registered construction workers. 1. The construction worker should be registered under the MBOCWW. 1. The applicant must be enrolled in a government-recognized MS-CIT course.

children.text: The children's parents/guardians should be registered construction workers.
The construction worker should be registered under the MBOCWW.
The applicant must be enrolled in a government-recognized MS-CIT course.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the MS-CIT course fee reimbursement?
faqs.answer: Children of registered construction workers in Maharashtra.

faqs.question: Is there a limit to the number of children who can benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the reimbursement is available for up to two children per registered worker.

faqs.question: What course is covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The MS-CIT (Maharashtra State Certificate in Information Technology) course.

faqs.question: Can the spouse of a registered worker avail of this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, this benefit is only for the children of the registered worker.

faqs.question: What documents are required to apply?
faqs.answer: Aadhaar Card, MS-CIT course fee receipt, enrollment certificate, previous academic marksheet, and proof of worker registration.

faqs.question: Is the course fee fully reimbursed?
faqs.answer: Yes, the full course fee is reimbursed under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the age limit for children to apply for the reimbursement?
faqs.answer: There is no specific age limit mentioned, but children must be enrolled in the course.

faqs.question: How do I prove enrollment in the MS-CIT course?
faqs.answer: Need to submit the course fee receipt and enrollment certificate from the institute.

faqs.question: Can I apply for reimbursement after completing the course?
faqs.answer: Yes, but you must submit proof of course completion and fee payment.

faqs.question: Is this scheme available for children studying outside Maharashtra?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme is only applicable for the MS-CIT course taken within Maharashtra.

faqs.question: What happens if the course fees are higher than expected?
faqs.answer: Only the official MS-CIT course fee will be reimbursed, as per the guidelines.

faqs.question: Where can I submit my application?
faqs.answer: At the nearest Labor Office or through the official Maharashtra Welfare Board.

children.text: Identity Card of Maharashtra Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board
Proof of Residence (One of Aadhaar Card/Passport/Driving Licence/Ration Sheet/Last Month's Electricity Bill/Gram Panchayat Certificate)

en.documentsRequired_md: - Passport-size Photo - Aadhaar Card - Identity Card of Maharashtra Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board - Bank Passbook - MS-CIT Passed Certificate - Fee Receipt - Proof of Residence (One of Aadhaar Card/Passport/Driving Licence/Ration Sheet/Last Month's Electricity Bill/Gram Panchayat Certificate)
